p:
Global warming has intensified the hydrological cycle, causing shifting rainfall patterns (in space and time) with more frequent extreme wet and/or dry years
1– 6 . Extreme wet years are predicted to increase both in frequency and intensity
1, 7 . Changes in the regime of extreme drought
4, 5 and extreme wetness
1, 7, 8 could have profound impacts on forests
9– 13 and their carbon balance
14 both locally and globally.
